statements.name: PROC MTSSCORE
statements.help:
PROC MTSSCORE  DATA=libref.data-table MODEL=libref.data-table<options>;                 
	BY variable;                 
	OUTPUT <options>;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC MTSSCORE to use

arguments.name: MODEL=
arguments.description: specifies the input binary file that contains the data-only analytic store that includes model information necessary for monitoring and diagnostics

arguments.name: COV=
arguments.description: specifies the input data table that contains the covariance matrix for all input variables

arguments.name: MEAN=
arguments.description: specifies the input data table that contains the means for all input variables

arguments.name: SCOREINFO=
arguments.description: specifies the input data table that contains scoring information

arguments.name: NOPLOT
arguments.description: suppresses the generation of ODS graphical output

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the generation of all ODS output

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads to use in the computation

arguments.name: THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: specifies the normalized Mahalanobis distance threshold for outlier (or fault) detection

statements.name: BY
statements.description: specifies the name of a single numeric variable to be used for BY-group processing in scoring and diagnostics

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: generates output tables that show the scoring and diagnostic results

arguments.name: GAINS=
arguments.description: names the output data table in which to store the diagnostic information

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC MTSSCORE to use

arguments.name: STAT=
arguments.description: names the output data table in which to store the summary status of the scoring and diagnostics
